title: Series and parallel - bulb resistor ammeter switch

content.question: Which of the following diagrams shows a light bulb and a resistor connected in parallel, and the bulb-resistor combination connected in series with an ammeter and a switch?

choices.label: The figure shows a horizontal portion of a circuit, and has from left to right a light bulb, a resistor, an ammeter, and a switch.

The figure shows a horizontal portion of a circuit, and has a light bulb, a resistor, an ammeter, and a switch. From left to right, the switch is shown. Then the circuit splits into two horizontal branches. The top horizontal branch has the light bulb. The bottom horizontal branch has the resistor. To the right of the point where the two branches merge, the ammeter is shown.

The figure shows a horizontal portion of a circuit, and has a light bulb, a resistor, an ammeter, and a switch. The circuit splits into three horizontal branches. From left to right, the top horizontal branch has the light bulb and the resistor. The middle horizontal branch has the switch. The bottom horizontal branch has the ammeter.

The figure shows a horizontal portion of a circuit, and has a light bulb, a resistor, an ammeter, and a switch. The circuit splits into four horizontal branches. The top horizontal branch has the switch. The bottom horizontal branch has the ammeter. The inner horizontal branch immediately below the top horizontal branch has the light bulb. The inner horizontal branch immediately above the bottom horizontal branch has the ammeter.

content.answer: The figure shows a horizontal portion of a circuit, and has a light bulb, a resistor, an ammeter, and a switch. From left to right, the switch is shown. Then the circuit splits into two horizontal branches. The top horizontal branch has the light bulb. The bottom horizontal branch has the resistor. To the right of the point where the two branches merge, the ammeter is shown.
